content.question: Directions: Answers must be in essay form. Outline form is NOT acceptable. Labeled diagrams may be used to supplement discussion, but in no case will a diagram alone suffice. It is important that you read each question completely before you begin. Information transfer is fundamental to all living organisms. For two of the following examples, explain in detail how the transfer of information is accomplished. (a) The genetic material in one eukaryotic cell is copied and distributed to two identical daughter cells

frqParts.text: Directions: Answers must be in essay form. Outline form is NOT acceptable. Labeled diagrams may be used to supplement discussion, but in no case will a diagram alone suffice. It is important that you read each question completely before you begin. Information transfer is fundamental to all living organisms. For two of the following examples, explain in detail how the transfer of information is accomplished. (a) The genetic material in one eukaryotic cell is copied and distributed to two identical daughter cells
(b) A gene in a eukaryotic cell is transcribed and translated to produce a protein
(c) The genetic material from one bacterial cell enters another via transformation, transduction, or conjugation
